Ross: She's gonna be a scientist! (kisses Rachel on the head, very moved)
Joey: (checking the last ticket) Damnit! anybody got anything?
Chandler: No.
Phoebe: I'm still looking through mine...
Monica: Just double checking (does so)...no, no, no...(takes off a shoe and takes a ticket out of it) No!
(phone rings)
Monica: (answering phone) Hello? Hold on. It's your boss.
Chandler: Ah, the "I'm sorry I rejected you" phone call. I'm not used to getting it from guys. (on the phone, getting up from the sofa) Hey, Steve.
Steve: Chandler, hi! I'm sure you've heard we filled the three positions. We just felt that with your maturity and experience, you wouldn't be happy being someone's assistant.
Chandler: Oh no no no no, I'd love to be somebody's assistant! Answering phones, getting coffee, I live for that stuff! And I'm not too mature... farts, boobies, butt cracks!
Steve: Chandler, you were the strongest person in the program. We're offering you the position of junior copywriter.
Chandler: Me, that guy who just said butt cracks?
Steve: Yes, that's right. We're excited about the level of sophistication you'll be bringing to the job.
Chandler: Ok well, thanks, you won't regret it. I'll see you tomorrow (hangs up).
(he idly goes to the sofa, starts browsing a magazine. Everybody stares at him)
Chandler: What? (pause) Oh, yeah, I'm gonna be a junior copywriter.
Everybody: (excited) Oh my God, congratulations!
Monica: Oh sweetie, I'm so proud of you!
Chandler: Does that mean I get the good loving tonight?
Monica: You bet! No TV or anything! (she gets up from the sofa and goes to the kitchen area)
Joey: (to Chandler) Hey, that is so great about the job. 
Chandler: Thanks, man.
Joey: And I like to think I had a little something to do with it.
Chandler: Really? What?
Joey: Well, before, with the wishbone... I didn't wish we would win the lottery, I wished you'd get the job.
Chandler: (smiling, surprised) Oh yeah? (looks towards the kitchen, worried) Listen, don't tell Monica, she'll rip your heart right out.
Joey: Oh yeah.
Rachel: You know what? There is a little part of me that really thought we were gonna win.
Ross: Me too. So much for my dinosaur/Amelia Earhart theme park.
Phoebe: You guys, what was the Powerball number again?
Monica and Ross: Seven.
Phoebe: We won.
Rachel: What?
Phoebe: We won!
Monica: Let me see!
(they all jump up excitedly and try to see the ticket)
Phoebe: Don't tear it.
Ross: Phoebe, you don't have any of the first five numbers.
Phoebe: I know that, but look, we've got the Powerball number, we've won 3 dollars!
Chandler: Wow, you'd think we should get that over 20 years or go for the big payout.
Phoebe: (still very excited) I don't care, I've never won anything before, I can't believe this!
Rachel: So Pheebs, what are you going to do with your $3?
Phoebe: It's not all mine. We all get 50 cents.
Monica: You know what? You can have mine.
Chandler: Me too.
Joey: Me too.
Rachel: Me too.
(they all look at Ross)
Ross: I guess if everybody else is...
Closing credits

lines.text: [Scene: Monica and Chandler's apartment. Monica, Chandler, Rachel and Joey are in the kitchen]

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: God! Look at all these tickets! It's so exciting! You know I haven't won anything since the sixth grade.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Pie eating contest?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh! You assume because I was heavy that's the only way I could win something?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: No, I saw a picture of you covered in blueberries.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: (smiling)That was a good day!
(Suddenly Ross comes running into the apartment)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (yelling to Monica)They're towing your car, they're towing your car!!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I'm parked in a garage on Morton!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (panting)They're towing a car. And I am seeing...spots.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (sounding panicky)Oh my god Ross! You don't have Emma! And Rachel you don't have Emma! (Starts yelling) Where's Emma? Who has Emma!?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Joey relax! My mother picked her up two hours ago. You were there!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (not yelling anymore)I was?

lines.speaker: Racel
lines.text: Yes and you talked to her...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I did?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: She dropped off a casserole?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Oh yeah! The casserole lady.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: (to Ross)So, did you come by to watch us win the big bucks?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Yeah, uh... and then I figured after you win, we could all go out to the balcony and see a night rainbow with gremlins dancing on top of it!
(phone starts ringing and Chandler comes running out of the bathroom)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: (hysterical)Don't touch the phone! I'll get it, I'll get it, I'll get it!! (picks up the phone)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (to Monica)Think he washed his hands?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: (into receiver)Hello? Hey Charlie, what do you know?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (to Monica)What's going on?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Chandler is supposed to find out if he's getting an assistent job at his ad agency. But out of the 15 interns, they are only hiring three.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Ooh! Tough odds!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (mockingly)Yeah if only it were a sure thing like your 24 state lottery!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (smiling)Look who's coming around!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: (still on the phone)Damnit. Alright call me when you know more.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (excited)Did you get it?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: One of the slots got filled.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (Still excited)By you!?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Sense the tone! No that kid Nate got it.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh! I hate that guy! I mean come on kid! Pull up your pants!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Yeah I know.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Well, there's two spots left right?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Yeah...I mean I want this so much! I mean, I wanna get one, I want my friend Charlie to get one...Except I don't care about Charlie.
(Phoebe enters)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (excited)Hey you guys! Ok, you're not going to believe this! I just saw my psychic and she said I was definitely gonna win the lottery tonight!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Hey that reminds me, I thought we could use some extra luck so I brought a wishbone home from work.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (mockingly)A psychic AND a wishbone? Guys! Give someone else a chance!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Alright, who wants to do it?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh can I? Vegetarians never get to do the wishbone. It's really not fair either! You know, just because we don't eat the meat doesn't mean we don't like to play with the carcasses!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Ok, hey Rach?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh no, I'm good, I don't wanna get that turkey smell all over my hands.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I'll do it!! It'll get the casserole stink off of mine.
(Phoebe and Joey both grab one side of the wishbone)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: I hope I win!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Well, it doesn't really matter ... you're both wishing for the same thing, right?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I can't tell you what I'm wishing for! Else...you know...won't come true!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Right! .. but we "know" what you're wishing for!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Can't really say!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I understand, but you're wishing for what we think you're wishing for, aren't you?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (slightly irritated)I'm not really comfortable with these questions!
Rachel, Chandler and Monica: Please, just do it!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: One, two, three!
(they break the wishbone)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I won, hey!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: You know what, I'm sure your wish is gonna come true, but, you guys - just in case, maybe a genie will come out if we rub this lamp! (rubs lamp, stops because it's very hot) Ah!! That thing gets hot!!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: You know, Ross, just keep making your jokes. How are you gonna feel if we actually do win?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Uh, you're not gonna win.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh, I know, I know, the odds are against us, but somebody has to win, and it could be us! And then how you gonna feel? You know, we're gonna be all like "oh everybody, let's take our helicopters up to the cape" and you're gonna be all like "oh, I can't guys, I'll meet you guys up there, I gotta gas up the Hyundai"

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Ok, I've heard myself on tape and I sound nothing like that.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I can see the headline now: "Lottery winners' friend filled with regret eats own arm".

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Why would I eat my own arm?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Well you wouldn't, but we own the paper, we can print whatever we want.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: You know what, Ross? I'm gonna throw in 50 bucks for you.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Because I know that you think the lottery is "boohaki" but we're all here and gonna watch the numbers and have fun. And you're my brother, and I want you to be a part of this.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: You don't have to do that, I'll pay for myself. But just the fact that you want me to have fun with you guys - that's so sweet! Come here (they kiss and hug)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Get a room!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Ok, so now that you're in, what are you gonna do if we win?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I don't know, probably just invest it.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Ooh! Calm down ...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Seriously, that's your fantasy? To invest it?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, I'm sorry, did I say "invest it"? I meant "be cool and piss it all away" (Joey and Chandler pleased)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Ooh, ooh, I know! We should pool all own money and buy the Knicks!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: I don't really care about the Knicks.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Oh, you will when I pick you as starting forward.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (touched) You would do that? I never get picked!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: You know, I'm not sure a sports team is the way to go.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: You're not gonna let me buy the Knicks?? I can't believe you're taking this away from me!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: You're right, it has been you dream for over 15 seconds.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (to Rachel) Uh, how long until they announce the numbers, Mommy?
(pause)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: (looks around) I'll take this one too (to Ross) Uh ... Mommy?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, I've gotten into the habit of calling Rachel "Mommy" when we're around Emma. Which I now realize we are not ...

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: I'm hoping that if she hears it enough it will be her first word.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Although if we're gonna do that, we should probably call me "Daddy" too.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oooh, I like that, "daddy" (in a sexy tone)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I ... I was just talking about Rachel.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (still in sexy tone) Oooh, is daddy getting angry? Is daddy gonna spank me?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (tries to be sexy too) Well that depends ... have you been a baaad gi .. (stops) no I can't.
(Phone rings, Chandler picks up)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Hello? Hello? Oh, hey Charlie. Did anybody else hear? ... What? Susan got it?? How? Oh man, I would have slept with him!! .. Alright, bye. (hangs up)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Dude, I'm sorry. But hey, there's one spot left, right?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Well no, Charlie's gonna get that.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Hey, don't say that! You got just as good a chance as anybody else of getting that job!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: He's the boss's son.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Come on, lottery!! (everybody cheers)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Ooh, you guys, it starts in like 20 minutes.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Ok, here we go. We need to sort out the tickets as quickly as possible to see if we've won. So does anybody have any ideas how to organize this? (doesn't let them answer) Ok, how about this: we divide them into 6 groups of 40, and the remaining 10 can be read by whoever finishes their pile first.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Ooh, I have another idea!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I'm sorry, idea time is over.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Ok, well, are all the tickets in the bowl?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: What about the ones you have on the nightstand?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: There are no tickets on the nightstand!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Yes there are, I just saw them a few minutes ago.
(Rachel get suspicious)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Un, no you didn't! You must be mistaken!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Honey, there are like 20 tickets on the nightstand!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Chandler, sense the tone!!
(Rachel comes out of their bedroom waving tickets)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Well, well, well, look what mommy found!!
(everyone's shocked)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Ok, fine!! I bought 20 extra tickets for me and Chandler.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Uh! The psychic also said that I would be betrayed.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I can't believe this, I thought we were all in this together!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Hey, you just got in 5 minutes ago!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: 3 minutes ago!!! I don't know why that's important ...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I was with you the whole time we were in Connecticut, when did you even get those?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: When you were reading the dirty magazines without taking off the plastic!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (to Ross) I'll show you how.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Ok, well Monica, suppose one of your "special" tickets win? How are you gonna feel when you win the lottery and you lose all your friends?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Please ... if I win the lottery, you guys are not gonna leave me. Someone gave me a basket of mini-muffins last week and I couldn't get rid of you for 3 days!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Chandler, would you just tell her what she did was wrong?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: (to Mon) She's right, you shouldn't have bought tickets just for us ...

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Ahhh!  (shocked)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Let me finish ... (to everyone else) however, it doesn't look like I'm gonna get this job so I can't afford to have principles, so screw you, the tickets are ours!! (takes tickets from Rachel)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: There's the man I married!!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: All right, believe me.If you win the lottery, it's the last you're gonna hear from us!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Fine! Don't be my friends! I'll buy new friends! Yeah, and then I'll pay for their plastic surgery so they'd look just like you!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (surprised) OH! Alright, you know what? That's it! I want my share of the tickets (picks up the bowl)!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Yeah, I want my tickets too (takes the bowl from Rachel)! And I'm buying the Knicks! And Steffi Graff, ah ah!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Than I want mine, too (takes the bowl from Joey)! And if I win I'm gonna put it all into a very low-yield bond.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh, you guys! We've got to keep all the tickets together (takes the bowl from Ross and puts it on the table)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: No, no! We should divide them up (picks up the bowl) and I should get extra because we used my card to buy them!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Hey, if anybody gets extra tickets, it should be me! This all thing was my idea! (takes the bowl from Monica)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Oh, yeah! Thanks for inventing the lottery!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Ok, that's it! Just give'em to me! I'll split them up! (she tries to snatch the bowl from Joey's hands but she can't, so she pinches his nipple and she manages to take it)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (in pain) Oh!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (she takes the bowl from Rachel's hands and she starts running around the room and yelling) OOOOOHHHHH!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (trying to stop her) Hey, hey!!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (keeping on running and yelling) OOOOOHHHHH! (she stops) Fine, I can't take it anymore! I'm putting an end to this! (she goes out to the balcony)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh, if she jumps, I get her tickets.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: No, no! (they all go towards the balcony but they get jammed in the window)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: If we are not doing it together, we're not doing it at all! So, say goodbye to your tickets! (She holds out the bowl, and makes as to drop the tickets on the street).

lines.speaker: Everyone
lines.text: NO!!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Don't come any closer!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Can I come a little bit closer, valuable things are getting squished...

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: No, what's more important, your friends or money?

lines.speaker: Everyone but Monica
lines.text: Friends!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Money! (they all look at her) Friends...

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Hey Monica, what about your extra tickets?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: They're all in there! Even these five that I hid in my bra (takes some tickets out of her bra and gives them to Phoebe)...

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Monica!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Ok, good! (pause) You guys were so scared! There was no way I was gonna dump this...(a pigeon swoops down, scaring Phoebe who drops the bowl on the street) Oh God, no! (pause) I think I broke your bowl.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Go, go, go!!
[Scene: Monica and Chandler's apartment.]
(All are returning from the street after picking up dropped lottery tickets)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: What a beautiful night to be running around the street, looking for tickets. And the wind sure made it fun.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Phoebe, we lost half of them.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: So, what? Monica, we have the winning ticket! My psychic said I  was gonna win, remember?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Weird.. your psychic didn't mention anything about the scary pigeon...

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: As a matter of fact she said that's how I am going to die. (pause ) So, excuse me for being a little skittish.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: (looking at the answering machine) Hey, there's two messages. These could be from work!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh, play them!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Ok, here we go! (he pushes the play button)

lines.speaker: Message
lines.text: (Phoebe's voice) "Hello. Th-this is the pigeon from the balcony calling to apologise" (they all turns to look at Phoebe) "I sh.. I shouldn't have knocked the tickets out of the pretty lady's hand. It-it was all my fault. Not hers. Bye. Coo."
(they all keep staring at Phoebe)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Well, I bet that was very hard for him to do.

lines.speaker: Second message
lines.text: "Hey Chandler, it's Charlie"

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: This is..shhh!

lines.speaker: Second Message
lines.text: "Listen, oh... it turns I got the last spot. I'm really sorry man, it was a lot of fun working with you. Give me a call if you want."

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh God, I am so sorry honey...

lines.speaker: All
lines.text: Oh, so sorry man! Sorry!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh, it is so unfair. It's like that time they promoted Sandra over me at work.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Oh, is she related to Ralph Lauren?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: No, she was just much better at job than me!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Guys, the drawing is about to start!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (To Ross) You know what? We should call my mum's house and say goodnight to Emma before she goes down.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh yeah, it's a good idea!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: (she hugs Chandler) Honey, you've been really strong about this, I know how badly you wanted that job.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Yeah, you know, I really thought I deserved it. (pause) But... let's go win the lottery... I mean, we still have 130 chances to win, right?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: (she draws out a ticket from a pocket of her pants) 131! (they kiss)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (on the phone) Goodnight sweetheart! I love you. And remember, you're daddy's little girl... (covering the phone, to Rachel) Phoebe's totally ruined that for me... (he passes the receiver to Rachel)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Hi mum, put her back on!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (sitting on the sofa in front of the tv) Rach, come on! They are announcing the numbers! My God, I can already feel myself changing.

lines.speaker: TV
lines.text: "Here we are, the official Powerball numbers! We have 53"

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I got that!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, we have one too!!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: We are on a roll, people!!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (calling Rachel) Come on!!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (on the phone) Mum, please!I know you love your new lips, but I can barely understand you! Would you, please, just let me say goodnight to my daughter?

lines.speaker: TV
lines.text: "And number 29! Here we go! The Powerball is 7"

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Check your numbers! Make me rich!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (she goes towards the others and she's very excited) Guys, you're not gonna believe this! I was just saying goodnight to Emma and she said her first words!!

lines.speaker: All
lines.text: Wow!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: And what did she say?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: She said "gleba"!! (she celebrates)
(they just look at her for a moment; then they go back to checking the tickets)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Make me rich!!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (to Ross) Isn't that amazing?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh yeah, no no no...that's great!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Why-why aren't you more excited?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, Rach...oh..."gleba" is not a word.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh, but of course it is!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Okay, what does it mean?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: I don't know all the words.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I'm just, I'm just glad I didn't miss my daughter's first words (goes back to checking the tickets).

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Yes you did, gleba is a word!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Ok, use it in a sentence.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Ok... "Emma just said gleba"!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: It's not a word!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Okay, okay, okay, fine, I'm gonna look it up (she goes and picks up the dictionary).

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, oh, ok, great. You know what, while you're at it she said another word the other day, why don't you, why don't you look up: pbbqqt....
(Rachel glares at him)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (searching the dictionary) Alright, okay, okay, gleba, gleba... (excited) Gleba! Ha! Here it is: the fleshy, spore-bearing inner mass of a certain fungi.
(Rachel shows Ross the definition on the dictionary, giving him a smug look; then she squints at the dictionary, as though unsure what to make out of it)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: She's gonna be a scientist! (kisses Rachel on the head, very moved)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (checking the last ticket) Damnit! anybody got anything?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: I'm still looking through mine...

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Just double checking (does so)...no, no, no...(takes off a shoe and takes a ticket out of it) No!
(phone rings)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: (answering phone) Hello? Hold on. It's your boss.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Ah, the "I'm sorry I rejected you" phone call. I'm not used to getting it from guys. (on the phone, getting up from the sofa) Hey, Steve.

lines.speaker: Steve
lines.text: Chandler, hi! I'm sure you've heard we filled the three positions. We just felt that with your maturity and experience, you wouldn't be happy being someone's assistant.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Oh no no no no, I'd love to be somebody's assistant! Answering phones, getting coffee, I live for that stuff! And I'm not too mature... farts, boobies, butt cracks!

lines.speaker: Steve
lines.text: Chandler, you were the strongest person in the program. We're offering you the position of junior copywriter.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Me, that guy who just said butt cracks?

lines.speaker: Steve
lines.text: Yes, that's right. We're excited about the level of sophistication you'll be bringing to the job.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Ok well, thanks, you won't regret it. I'll see you tomorrow (hangs up).
(he idly goes to the sofa, starts browsing a magazine. Everybody stares at him)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: What? (pause) Oh, yeah, I'm gonna be a junior copywriter.

lines.speaker: Everybody
lines.text: (excited) Oh my God, congratulations!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh sweetie, I'm so proud of you!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Does that mean I get the good loving tonight?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: You bet! No TV or anything! (she gets up from the sofa and goes to the kitchen area)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (to Chandler) Hey, that is so great about the job.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Thanks, man.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: And I like to think I had a little something to do with it.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Really? What?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Well, before, with the wishbone... I didn't wish we would win the lottery, I wished you'd get the job.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: (smiling, surprised) Oh yeah? (looks towards the kitchen, worried) Listen, don't tell Monica, she'll rip your heart right out.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: You know what? There is a little part of me that really thought we were gonna win.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Me too. So much for my dinosaur/Amelia Earhart theme park.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: You guys, what was the Powerball number again?

lines.speaker: Monica and Ross
lines.text: Seven.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: We won.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: We won!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Let me see!
(they all jump up excitedly and try to see the ticket)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Don't tear it.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Phoebe, you don't have any of the first five numbers.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: I know that, but look, we've got the Powerball number, we've won 3 dollars!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Wow, you'd think we should get that over 20 years or go for the big payout.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (still very excited) I don't care, I've never won anything before, I can't believe this!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: So Pheebs, what are you going to do with your $3?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: It's not all mine. We all get 50 cents.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: You know what? You can have mine.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Me too.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Me too.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Me too.
(they all look at Ross)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I guess if everybody else is...
Closing credits

location: Central Perk. They're all sitting there as usual
scene_description: except Joey. Gunther is serving a nearby table.
raw_text:
[Scene: Central Perk. They're all sitting there as usual, except Joey. Gunther is serving a nearby table.]
(Joey comes in from the back of the coffee house)
Joey: (sitting in a chair) Hey guys, so I just called the Powerball hotline, can you believe it? Nobody won.
Phoebe: I beg to differ (shows him her cup of coffee and her plate of cookies).
Gunther: Maybe nobody won the jackpot, but there was this guy in here earlier, and he found the ticket on the street, right outside, and won $10,000 (goes to the counter).
(They all glare evilly at Phoebe)
Phoebe: (hides her mouth behind the cup and speaks in the "pigeon voice" from before) Coo, again. Don't blame the pretty lady. It was not her fault. It was me, the pigeon, coo! (pause) Seriously, stop staring at her.
(Joey stares around dumbly looking for the "talking pigeon")
FRIENDS 919 - THE ONE WITH RACHEL'S DREAM
Teleplay: Mark Kunerth Story: Dana Klein Directed by: Terry Hughes Transcribed by: Eleonora, Pheeboh, Sebastiano & Vanessa
[Scene: Rachel and Joey's apartment]
Joey: (talking to a pineapple in his hand) God, you're beautiful...why are we fighting this?You know you want it to happen as much as I do.
(Rachel comes out of her room and starts staring at him unseen)
Joey: I want you.I need you.Let me make love to you.
Rachel: I don't wanna stand in the way of true love or anything, but I think a  cantaloupe might hurt less.
Joey: Oh, ehm...I'm...I'm rehearsing my lines.They gave me a big romantic story on Days Of Our Lives. It's the first time my character's got one. I'm so nervous, you know, I really want it to be good!
Rachel: Woow!I haven't seen you this worked up since you did that dog food commercial and you thought you were gonna be with a real talking dog!
Joey: Yeah, that was a disappointment...(pause) Oh, hey!D'you want to come down to the set and tell me if I'm doing ok?
Rachel: (excited) Are you serious?
Joey: Yeah!Hey, you just have to promise not to get yourself thrown out again.
Rachel: Hey, that was an honest mistake!
Joey: Right!(he starts to ape her)"Oh my God, is this the men's room? Oh, I feel so foolish, have you always known you wanted to be an actor?" (he inclines his head as if to look at a man's private parts)
Rachel: Yeah, that was an awesome day!
Opening credits
[Scene: Central Perk]
Monica: Hey!
Phoebe: Hey!
Ross: Hi!
Monica: So, do you guys wanna come and eat dinner at the restaurant sometime in the next few weeks?
Phoebe: Sure!
Ross: I'd love to!
Monica: Well you can't! We're booked solid for the next month!
Phoebe: Well, I can't give you a massage, because my licence has been revoked again!
Ross: Phoebe, what happened?
Phoebe: Well, it was an accident...You know, it's a lot of oil and sometimes the hand just slips!
(Chandler enters)
Chandler: (To Monica) Have I got a surprise for you? Pack your bags!
Phoebe: Oh no!You guys aren't supposed to get divorced for 7 years!
Chandler: What? No, I'm taking Monica to a romantic inn in Vermont (shows them a brochure)!
Phoebe: Oh, good!Ok, good for you!Try to recapture the magic!
Chandler: So, what do you say? Can you get out of work?
Monica: Oh, honey!I can't. I was just telling these guys that things are crazy at the restaurant!
Chandler: Are you really that busy?
Monica: Yeah, I'm sorry. I really am.
Chandler: Oh, that's ok.I'll just try and reschedule. (on the phone) "Hi, this is Chandler Bing. I made a reservation there and I need to change it (pause) Oh, what do you mean it's not refundable? Can I just come some other time? (pause) Oh, can't you make an exception?"
Monica: Tell them I'm a chef in a big New York restaurant!
Phoebe: And tell them that in 2 weeks I will once again be a masseuse in good standing!
Chandler: (on the phone) "Look, this is ridiculous! I'm not paying for that room! Ok?" (pause) "Oh, thank you very much!" (hangs up) Yeah, I'm going to Vermont...
Ross: Oh, don't worry about it! Just use your travel insurance.
Chandler: I don't have travel insurance.
Ross: Well, this is what happens when people live on the edge!
Monica: Why don't you take Ross?
Ross: Uh, don't you think that would be a little weird? I mean, two guys in a romantic inn...
Monica: No, not if their room has two beds!
Ross: (browsing the brochure) I guess...It still seems a little...(enthusiastically) moonlight boat ride!!
[Scene: Days of Our Lives' Studios]
Rachel: Hey Joey, is this the bed where Olivia lost her virginity?
Joey: I don't know, but one of the extras sure did! (pause) Hey, listen Rach. Thanks again for coming down to watch my scenes!
Rachel: Oh, please!Honey, just the fact that you want me here to support you, I'm...OH MY GOD!Is that Christian Sanders?He's so gorgeous!
Joey: Also so gay!
Rachel: Oh, in my head he's done some pretty "not-gay-stuff"!
Joey: Well, at the Christmas party him and Santa did some definitely gay stuff!
Director: Joey, Joey! We're ready for you!
Joey: Oh, wish me luck!
Rachel: Ok, not that you need it but good...GOD!Is that Chase Lassiter?He's straight, right?
Joey: Rach, I gotta say...if you weren't here wondering if these guys were gay I don't know if I could do this!
Rachel: Oh, I'm sorry, you're right.I'm sorry, good luck! (they hug)
Director: On a bell please! Quietly.. and ACTION!
(the scene starts.Joey enters and there's a girl wearing a wedding dress near a bed)
Actress/Olivia: Drake! What are you doing in here?
Joey/Drake: Stopping you from marrying the wrong man and making the biggest mistake of your life.
Actress/Olivia: Get out!
Joey/Drake: You don't love him!
Actress/Olivia: What do you know about love?
Joey/Drake: I know what I felt that night when we kissed under the bridge.
Actress/Olivia: That kiss never happened.
Joey/Drake: Oh, what about this one.
(the actress slaps him)
Rachel: (watching a television where the scene is shown, startled) OH!
Actress/Olivia: No, I told you...get out!
Joey/Drake: Fine. I'll go. But let me ask you one question...
Chase Lassiter: (talking to Rachel) You look familiar, have we...
Rachel: SSSHHHHTTT!!He's asking her a question!!
Joey/Drake: Can you really live the rest of your life never knowing what we could have been?
Actress/Olivia: I don't have a choice...
Joey/Drake: Yes, you do.Yes...you do. I'm the one who doesn't have a choice because I...because I can't stop loving you.
Actress/Olivia: Don't say that...
Joey/Drake: Tell me to stop, just...tell me to stop. (he's about to kiss her)
Director: CUT!
Rachel: NO! (pause) Or, cut!You know, that's your call!
[Scene: Monica's restaurant]
1st Customer: Everything was delicious!
Monica: Thank you!
2nd Customer: It was. The duck in particular was superb.
Monica: Thank you!(she looks at the 3rd customer waiting for a compliment) You haven't said anything...
3rd Customer: Actually I do have one small complaint.
Monica: Oh..please!I-I welcome criticism.
3rd Customer: The musician right outside the restaurant...it's kind of a mood-killer!
Monica: What musician?
[Scene: Outside the restaurant]
Phoebe: (playing guitar and singing) And there's a country called Argentinaaaa, it's a place I've never seeeeen. But I'm told for fifty pesos you can buy a human spleen. Humaaan spleeeeen. Ol!
Monica: What are you doing here!
Phoebe: Well, you said that you had customers lined up in the street, so I am here to entertain!
Monica: Great!
Phoebe: Yeah! It really has been great too, you know, some of this people must have seen me play before because they were requesting a bunch of my songs! Yeah, "You suck" and "shut up and go home".
Monica: Listen Phoebe...
Phoebe: Yeah.
Monica: You know how much I love listening to your music, you know, but...
Phoebe: But what?
Monica: This is kind of a classy place.
Phoebe: (pause) Ok, say no more.
[Time lapse: Phoebe in front of restaurant again]
Phoebe: (with a fancy dress, still playing and singing): It wasn't just that she was fat, the woman smelled like garbage! Everyone! It wasn't just that she was fat the woman smelled like garbaaaaaage! (to Monica, showing her dress) Classy, uh?
(Monica covers her face with her hands)
[Scene: hall of the romantic inn in Vermont]
Chandler: Hi, Chandler Bing, I have a reservation.
Receptionist: Welcome to the Chestnut Inn Mr. Bing, so where are you joining from?
Chandler: New York.
Ross: (in a strange voice and eating candies) The big apple!
Chandler: I'm sorry, he's a little bit wound up, we had to stop at every maple candy stand on the way here.
Ross: Yeah, I ate all my gifts for everybody.
Receptionist: I am sorry Mr. Bing, there's no record of your reservation in the computer.
Chandler: Well, that's impossible, can you check again, please?
Ross: (high pitched voice) Check again please!
Receptionist: I'm sorry, it's not here.
Ross: Not there.
Chandler: Let me get this straight. I called yesterday trying to cancel my reservation and I was told it was not refundable, then we drove six hours all the way up here and now you tell me that we don't have a reservation?
Receptionist: I don't know what to say.
Ross: (mumbling) She doesn't know what to say!
Chandler: Just give us the cheapest room you have.
Receptionist: Unfortunatly the only thing we have available is our deluxe suite, the rate is six hundred dollars.
Chandler: That's insane!
Ross: Totally insane. Dude, let's drive home, we'll hit all the maple candy stores on the way back and if...if they're closed maybe we'll tap a tree and make some ourselves.
Chandler: Does that room have a closet I can lock him in? (pause) We'll take it.
Receptionist: Great.
Chandler: (aside, to Ross) What!? They are totally ripping us off!
Ross: Dude, don't worry 'bout it! I know how we can make your money back! This is a nice hotel, you know, plenty of amenities, we just load up on those! Like those apples. Instead of taking one, I'm... I take six!
Chandler: Great, at a hundred dollars an apple, we're there!
Ross: C'mon, you get the idea, ow-ow-ow we'll make our money back in no time!
Chandler: Dude, you're shaking!
Ross: I think it's the sugar, could you hold the apple?
[Scene: Joey's apartment]
Rachel: Hi!
Joey: Hey!
Rachel: Joey, I gotta tell ya, I've been thinking all day about that scene you did, I mean, you were amazing!
Joey: Oh, you know, the writing was good, and the director is good, and... and my co-star's good but they're not as good as me!
Rachel: God, you have to tell me what happens tomorrow!
Joey: Ow, I'm just going over the script now! You wanna read lines with me?
Rachel: Me? Oh, no, I am not an actress.
Joey: Oh, all right, I can ask Monica.
Rachel: Oh screw her, that part is mine!
Joey: Right... (pause) ok, so just from the top of the page, right here.
Rachel: Okay. (pause).(acting) Hello Drake, I'm surprised to see you here.
Joey/Drake: I can't believe you married him.
Rachel/actress: But what choice did I have. He was keeping my sister in a dungeon!
Joey/Drake: So what about us? Everything we feel for each other.
Rachel/actress: It's over! You have to accept that.
Joey/Drake: How can I? Knowing I'll never hold you in my arms again, or touch your skin, or feel your lips, knowing I'll never make love to you? How can I accept that... I can never kiss you again when it's all I can do not to kiss you right now.
Rachel: (pause) Kiss me.
Joey: What?
Rachel: Kiss me.
Joey: Ah, Rach, it doesn't say that!
Rachel: No, I'm saying...
Joey: but, but..
Rachel: just... don't talk... (she kisses him)
[Scene: Rachel's bedroom]
Rachel: (waking up) Ehhh, aw! (pause). Well, that's new!
[Scene: Hotel's room]
Ross: (on the phone) Hi, this is Ross Geller in suite 206. It seems you forgot a couple of things. Could you have some complimentary toiletries sent up to my room? (pause) Thank you! Ok. Toothbrush, toothpaste, razor, mouthwash, deodorant, dental floss, band aids, shaving cream, after shave... and I feel like I am forgetting something... Is there anything else you have that I haven't asked for already? (pause) Yeah, go ahead, send up some tampons. 
(Chandler enters the room)
Ross: What did you get?
Chandler: USA Today
Ross: Nice, put it with the others.
Chandler: And I also got... two more apples.
Ross: We are four short of a bush-o (pause). God I feel so alive, I love being in the country!  
Chandler: I also got this great salt and pepper shaker from the restaurant.
Ross: Oh, that's not cool.
Chandlers: Dude, none of this is cool.
Ross: No, Chandler, you have to find the line between stealing and taking what the hotel owes you. For example: hair drier, no, no, no, but shampoo and conditioners, yes, yes, yes. (pause) Now, the salt shaker is off-limits, but the salt (he opens the salt shaker and pours the salt into his hand) I wish I'd thought this through.
Chandler: I think I know what you mean though...the lamp is the hotel's, but the bulbs (goes to take the bulb)...oh, you already got that.
Ross: Not my first time in a hotel, my friend.
Chandler: Ok, how about this (picks up the remote control)?
Ross: No, no, no, you can't take the remote control!
Chandler: Yes, but the batteries...
(Ross claps his hands)
Chandler: Thank you, thank you very much!
Ross: Let's celebrate with some maple candy!
Chandler: No!
Ross: At least tell me where you hid it.
[Scene: Central Perk. Monica and Rachel are sitting on the sofa]
Rachel: Can I ask you a question?
Monica: Yeah.
Rachel: Have you ever had any weird romantic dreams?
Monica: Let me think. Oh, when I was younger I used to dream that I got married to Mayor McCheese, and on our wedding night I ate his head.
Rachel: Ok, well this is like that...in no way. I had a...I had a dream last night that I wanted to kiss Joey.
Monica: Wow, do you mean like kiss him-kiss him?
Rachel: Oh yeah! I mean, that was pretty intense.
Monica: What do you think brought than on?
Rachel: I don't know! I mean, maybe that's something to do with the fact that I saw him do a love scene yesterday.
Monica: A love scene? With who?
Rachel: Olivia.
Monica: Olivia? I thought she was marrying Connor! (pause) Oh right, real life more important.
Rachel: So do you think that my dream means anything?
Monica: I don't know. I mean, you saw him do a love scene, so maybe you don't have a thing for Joey, maybe you have a thing for Drake.
Rachel: Ah! Well it was Joey reading Drake's lines in the dream...
Monica: Of course it was! Trust me, when it comes to psychology I know what I'm talking about. I took two psych classes in college. 
Rachel: You took the same class twice.
Monica: It was hard!
(Phoebe comes in)
Phoebe: Hey!
Rachel and Monica: Hi.
Phoebe: Here, Monica, look what I got to wear when I play at the restaurant (she dons a top hat) uh, huh wait! (she raises a pair of spectacles to her eyes) Right? I mean, this might even class up the ballad of the uncircumcised man.
Monica: Oh...Phoebe? Maybe I wasn't clear before. I really love listening to your music here, but my restaurant is sort of an upscale place.
Phoebe: Right, yeah, ok, I'll ask the butler to fetch my diamonds out of the vault.
Monica: Phoebe, it's not what you wear. It's sort of your songs... I just don't think you should play at the restaurant anymore.
Phoebe: Oh, ok. Fine, I'll just, I'll take the hat back (she puts the hat in a bag and she crushes it angrily on the floor with her foot).
(silence)
Rachel: Hey, so you guys, the funniest thing happened, at work...
Phoebe: My songs aren't good enough for your restaurant?
Rachel: Ok, we're still on that.
Monica: I didn't say your songs were not good enough.
Phoebe: Then what's wrong with them? Would they not go with your tiny portions of pretentious food?
Monica: Tiny portions?
Phoebe: Yeah well, "excuse me, I ordered the smoked salmon appetizer, but (peering through her spectacles) I can't see it, I can't see it"!
Monica: Phoebe, it's not about quantity.
Phoebe: Well...it's not about quality.
Monica: Oh really, you want to talk about quality? Have you heard of a key? It's what some people sing in.
Phoebe: Well at least all my songs don't taste like garlic. Yeah, there are other ingredients Monica.
Monica: Ok, so that's what we're doing. You know, when I'm in the coffee house bopping along to one of your songs, I'm wearing ear plugs.
Phoebe: Ear plugs, or cloves of garlic?
Monica: You know what? I take back what I said before. You keep playing at the restaurant, because with your music driving people inside, my bar sales are going up like crazy.
Phoebe: What are people having, the garlic Martini?
[Scene: Hotel's reception]
Receptionist: Here's your copy of the bill, we hope you enjoyed your stay.
Chandler: Oh we did, and you still have all your lamps.
(the receptions is puzzled. She goes in the back.)
Chandler: Oh, I didn't factor in the room tax.
Ross: Oh dude, don't worry about it, I found an unattended maid's car. We're way ahead of the game.
(they make as if to go, but Ross notices something)
Ross: Oh my god.
Chandler: What?
Ross: There's something new in the bowl.
Chandler: Look, we have enough, just walk away.
Ross: No, but I want...I want the pinecones!
Chandler: There's a forest right outside.
Ross: It's not the same.
Chandler: Ok, go quick!
(Ross starts stuffing pinecones in the suitcase. As the receptionist walks in, Chandler makes a bird's verse and Ross stops)
Ross: (to the receptionist) Thank you for a delightful stay.
(he picks up the suitcase, which falls open, revealing all the stuff they have taken from the hotel. The receptionist just looks at them.)
Ross: Oh, my maple candy!
[Scene: In front of Monica's restaurant. Phoebe is playing]
Phoebe: (singing) Food here at 'Javu'..will kill you..the food here at 'Javu' ...will kill you..
(Monica comes out)
Monica: Thank god, it's just you! I thought someone was swinging a bag of cats against the wall.
Phoebe: You'd better get back in that kitchen Monica, the garlic is not gonna overuse itself.
Monica: Ok, you have to stop playing now.
Phoebe: Why? The only person my playing is bothering is you!
Monica: Oh yeah? Ok, let's settle this, come on!
Phoebe: (while Monica drags her in the restaurant) Get your garlic-peelers off me!
Monica: (to the restuarant customers) Excuse me, excuse me, hi, I'm Monica Geller..I'm the head chef here.. (pauses as if waiting for something).. Ok, I was actually expecting a little applause there, but whatever! Ok, quick question: by a show of hands, how many of you were bothered by this woman's singing outside? (a few people raise their hands)
Phoebe: Ok, ok, how many of you enjoyed the music outside? (a few people raise their hands) Ha!
Monica: Alright, let me ask you this question: How many of you thought the music was fine, but not in keeping with the tone of the restaurant? (a few raise their hands again).
Phoebe: Ok, well, who identified the tone of this restaurant as pretentious comma garlicky?
Monica: Ok who thinks the food is delicious and a little pretention never hurt anyone? (a few raise their hands)
Phoebe: Ok, well, alright, who thinks the food is fine, the music was fine, but your evening was ruined by this incessant poll taking? (all raise their hands).
Monica: Excuse us! (then to Phoebe) Alright here's a question: Who was so worried about her restaurant being fancy that she made a big deal about her friend playing her music and feels really bad about it now? (raises her hand)
Phoebe: Oh...Who was so stupid and stubborn that she lashed out against her friend's cooking which she actually thinks is pretty great! (raises her hand)
Monica: I'm sorry...
Phoebe: I'm sorry too... (they hug)
Monica: ooohh... hey! Wanna stick around and I'll whip you up some dinner? 
Phoebe: Yeah! As long as it's free! Food here is ridiculously over-p... 
(Monica seems to take it amiss)
Phoebe: (smiling, raising her hand) Who's hoping the hand raising thing is still cute enough that you won't hate me?

lines.text: [Scene: Central Perk. They're all sitting there as usual, except Joey. Gunther is serving a nearby table.]
(Joey comes in from the back of the coffee house)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (sitting in a chair) Hey guys, so I just called the Powerball hotline, can you believe it? Nobody won.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: I beg to differ (shows him her cup of coffee and her plate of cookies).

lines.speaker: Gunther
lines.text: Maybe nobody won the jackpot, but there was this guy in here earlier, and he found the ticket on the street, right outside, and won $10,000 (goes to the counter).
(They all glare evilly at Phoebe)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (hides her mouth behind the cup and speaks in the "pigeon voice" from before) Coo, again. Don't blame the pretty lady. It was not her fault. It was me, the pigeon, coo! (pause) Seriously, stop staring at her.
(Joey stares around dumbly looking for the "talking pigeon")
FRIENDS 919 - THE ONE WITH RACHEL'S DREAM

lines.speaker: Teleplay
lines.text: Mark Kunerth Story: Dana Klein Directed by: Terry Hughes Transcribed by: Eleonora, Pheeboh, Sebastiano & Vanessa
[Scene: Rachel and Joey's apartment]

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (talking to a pineapple in his hand) God, you're beautiful...why are we fighting this?You know you want it to happen as much as I do.
(Rachel comes out of her room and starts staring at him unseen)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I want you.I need you.Let me make love to you.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: I don't wanna stand in the way of true love or anything, but I think a  cantaloupe might hurt less.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Oh, ehm...I'm...I'm rehearsing my lines.They gave me a big romantic story on Days Of Our Lives. It's the first time my character's got one. I'm so nervous, you know, I really want it to be good!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Woow!I haven't seen you this worked up since you did that dog food commercial and you thought you were gonna be with a real talking dog!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Yeah, that was a disappointment...(pause) Oh, hey!D'you want to come down to the set and tell me if I'm doing ok?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (excited) Are you serious?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Yeah!Hey, you just have to promise not to get yourself thrown out again.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Hey, that was an honest mistake!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Right!(he starts to ape her)"Oh my God, is this the men's room? Oh, I feel so foolish, have you always known you wanted to be an actor?" (he inclines his head as if to look at a man's private parts)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Yeah, that was an awesome day!
Opening credits
[Scene: Central Perk]

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: So, do you guys wanna come and eat dinner at the restaurant sometime in the next few weeks?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Sure!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I'd love to!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Well you can't! We're booked solid for the next month!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Well, I can't give you a massage, because my licence has been revoked again!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Phoebe, what happened?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Well, it was an accident...You know, it's a lot of oil and sometimes the hand just slips!
(Chandler enters)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: (To Monica) Have I got a surprise for you? Pack your bags!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh no!You guys aren't supposed to get divorced for 7 years!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: What? No, I'm taking Monica to a romantic inn in Vermont (shows them a brochure)!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh, good!Ok, good for you!Try to recapture the magic!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: So, what do you say? Can you get out of work?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh, honey!I can't. I was just telling these guys that things are crazy at the restaurant!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Are you really that busy?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Yeah, I'm sorry. I really am.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Oh, that's ok.I'll just try and reschedule. (on the phone) "Hi, this is Chandler Bing. I made a reservation there and I need to change it (pause) Oh, what do you mean it's not refundable? Can I just come some other time? (pause) Oh, can't you make an exception?"

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Tell them I'm a chef in a big New York restaurant!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: And tell them that in 2 weeks I will once again be a masseuse in good standing!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: (on the phone) "Look, this is ridiculous! I'm not paying for that room! Ok?" (pause) "Oh, thank you very much!" (hangs up) Yeah, I'm going to Vermont...

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, don't worry about it! Just use your travel insurance.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I don't have travel insurance.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Well, this is what happens when people live on the edge!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Why don't you take Ross?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Uh, don't you think that would be a little weird? I mean, two guys in a romantic inn...

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: No, not if their room has two beds!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (browsing the brochure) I guess...It still seems a little...(enthusiastically) moonlight boat ride!!
[Scene: Days of Our Lives' Studios]

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Hey Joey, is this the bed where Olivia lost her virginity?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I don't know, but one of the extras sure did! (pause) Hey, listen Rach. Thanks again for coming down to watch my scenes!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh, please!Honey, just the fact that you want me here to support you, I'm...OH MY GOD!Is that Christian Sanders?He's so gorgeous!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Also so gay!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh, in my head he's done some pretty "not-gay-stuff"!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Well, at the Christmas party him and Santa did some definitely gay stuff!

lines.speaker: Director
lines.text: Joey, Joey! We're ready for you!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Oh, wish me luck!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Ok, not that you need it but good...GOD!Is that Chase Lassiter?He's straight, right?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Rach, I gotta say...if you weren't here wondering if these guys were gay I don't know if I could do this!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh, I'm sorry, you're right.I'm sorry, good luck! (they hug)

lines.speaker: Director
lines.text: On a bell please! Quietly.. and ACTION!
(the scene starts.Joey enters and there's a girl wearing a wedding dress near a bed)
Actress/Olivia: Drake! What are you doing in here?
Joey/Drake: Stopping you from marrying the wrong man and making the biggest mistake of your life.
Actress/Olivia: Get out!
Joey/Drake: You don't love him!
Actress/Olivia: What do you know about love?
Joey/Drake: I know what I felt that night when we kissed under the bridge.
Actress/Olivia: That kiss never happened.
Joey/Drake: Oh, what about this one.
(the actress slaps him)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (watching a television where the scene is shown, startled) OH!
Actress/Olivia: No, I told you...get out!
Joey/Drake: Fine. I'll go. But let me ask you one question...

lines.speaker: Chase Lassiter
lines.text: (talking to Rachel) You look familiar, have we...

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: SSSHHHHTTT!!He's asking her a question!!
Joey/Drake: Can you really live the rest of your life never knowing what we could have been?
Actress/Olivia: I don't have a choice...
Joey/Drake: Yes, you do.Yes...you do. I'm the one who doesn't have a choice because I...because I can't stop loving you.
Actress/Olivia: Don't say that...
Joey/Drake: Tell me to stop, just...tell me to stop. (he's about to kiss her)

lines.speaker: Director
lines.text: CUT!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: NO! (pause) Or, cut!You know, that's your call!
[Scene: Monica's restaurant]
1st Customer: Everything was delicious!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Thank you!
2nd Customer: It was. The duck in particular was superb.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Thank you!(she looks at the 3rd customer waiting for a compliment) You haven't said anything...
3rd Customer: Actually I do have one small complaint.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh..please!I-I welcome criticism.
3rd Customer: The musician right outside the restaurant...it's kind of a mood-killer!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: What musician?
[Scene: Outside the restaurant]

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (playing guitar and singing) And there's a country called Argentinaaaa, it's a place I've never seeeeen. But I'm told for fifty pesos you can buy a human spleen. Humaaan spleeeeen. Ol!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: What are you doing here!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Well, you said that you had customers lined up in the street, so I am here to entertain!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Great!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Yeah! It really has been great too, you know, some of this people must have seen me play before because they were requesting a bunch of my songs! Yeah, "You suck" and "shut up and go home".

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Listen Phoebe...

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: You know how much I love listening to your music, you know, but...

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: But what?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: This is kind of a classy place.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (pause) Ok, say no more.
[Time lapse: Phoebe in front of restaurant again]

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (with a fancy dress, still playing and singing): It wasn't just that she was fat, the woman smelled like garbage! Everyone! It wasn't just that she was fat the woman smelled like garbaaaaaage! (to Monica, showing her dress) Classy, uh?
(Monica covers her face with her hands)
[Scene: hall of the romantic inn in Vermont]

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Hi, Chandler Bing, I have a reservation.

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.text: Welcome to the Chestnut Inn Mr. Bing, so where are you joining from?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: New York.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (in a strange voice and eating candies) The big apple!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I'm sorry, he's a little bit wound up, we had to stop at every maple candy stand on the way here.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Yeah, I ate all my gifts for everybody.

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.text: I am sorry Mr. Bing, there's no record of your reservation in the computer.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Well, that's impossible, can you check again, please?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (high pitched voice) Check again please!

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.text: I'm sorry, it's not here.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Not there.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Let me get this straight. I called yesterday trying to cancel my reservation and I was told it was not refundable, then we drove six hours all the way up here and now you tell me that we don't have a reservation?

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.text: I don't know what to say.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (mumbling) She doesn't know what to say!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Just give us the cheapest room you have.

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.text: Unfortunatly the only thing we have available is our deluxe suite, the rate is six hundred dollars.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: That's insane!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Totally insane. Dude, let's drive home, we'll hit all the maple candy stores on the way back and if...if they're closed maybe we'll tap a tree and make some ourselves.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Does that room have a closet I can lock him in? (pause) We'll take it.

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.text: Great.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: (aside, to Ross) What!? They are totally ripping us off!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Dude, don't worry 'bout it! I know how we can make your money back! This is a nice hotel, you know, plenty of amenities, we just load up on those! Like those apples. Instead of taking one, I'm... I take six!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Great, at a hundred dollars an apple, we're there!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: C'mon, you get the idea, ow-ow-ow we'll make our money back in no time!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Dude, you're shaking!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I think it's the sugar, could you hold the apple?
[Scene: Joey's apartment]

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Joey, I gotta tell ya, I've been thinking all day about that scene you did, I mean, you were amazing!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Oh, you know, the writing was good, and the director is good, and... and my co-star's good but they're not as good as me!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: God, you have to tell me what happens tomorrow!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Ow, I'm just going over the script now! You wanna read lines with me?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Me? Oh, no, I am not an actress.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Oh, all right, I can ask Monica.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh screw her, that part is mine!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Right... (pause) ok, so just from the top of the page, right here.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Okay. (pause).(acting) Hello Drake, I'm surprised to see you here.
Joey/Drake: I can't believe you married him.
Rachel/actress: But what choice did I have. He was keeping my sister in a dungeon!
Joey/Drake: So what about us? Everything we feel for each other.
Rachel/actress: It's over! You have to accept that.

Joey/Drake: How can I? Knowing I'll never hold you in my arms again, or touch your skin, or feel your lips, knowing I'll never make love to you? How can I accept that... I can never kiss you again when it's all I can do not to kiss you right now.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (pause) Kiss me.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Kiss me.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Ah, Rach, it doesn't say that!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: No, I'm saying...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: but, but..

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: just... don't talk... (she kisses him)
[Scene: Rachel's bedroom]

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (waking up) Ehhh, aw! (pause). Well, that's new!
[Scene: Hotel's room]

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (on the phone) Hi, this is Ross Geller in suite 206. It seems you forgot a couple of things. Could you have some complimentary toiletries sent up to my room? (pause) Thank you! Ok. Toothbrush, toothpaste, razor, mouthwash, deodorant, dental floss, band aids, shaving cream, after shave... and I feel like I am forgetting something... Is there anything else you have that I haven't asked for already? (pause) Yeah, go ahead, send up some tampons.
(Chandler enters the room)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: What did you get?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: USA Today

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Nice, put it with the others.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: And I also got... two more apples.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: We are four short of a bush-o (pause). God I feel so alive, I love being in the country!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I also got this great salt and pepper shaker from the restaurant.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, that's not cool.

lines.speaker: Chandlers
lines.text: Dude, none of this is cool.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: No, Chandler, you have to find the line between stealing and taking what the hotel owes you. For example: hair drier, no, no, no, but shampoo and conditioners, yes, yes, yes. (pause) Now, the salt shaker is off-limits, but the salt (he opens the salt shaker and pours the salt into his hand) I wish I'd thought this through.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I think I know what you mean though...the lamp is the hotel's, but the bulbs (goes to take the bulb)...oh, you already got that.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Not my first time in a hotel, my friend.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Ok, how about this (picks up the remote control)?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: No, no, no, you can't take the remote control!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Yes, but the batteries...
(Ross claps his hands)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Thank you, thank you very much!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Let's celebrate with some maple candy!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: At least tell me where you hid it.
[Scene: Central Perk. Monica and Rachel are sitting on the sofa]

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Can I ask you a question?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Have you ever had any weird romantic dreams?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Let me think. Oh, when I was younger I used to dream that I got married to Mayor McCheese, and on our wedding night I ate his head.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Ok, well this is like that...in no way. I had a...I had a dream last night that I wanted to kiss Joey.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Wow, do you mean like kiss him-kiss him?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh yeah! I mean, that was pretty intense.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: What do you think brought than on?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: I don't know! I mean, maybe that's something to do with the fact that I saw him do a love scene yesterday.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: A love scene? With who?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Olivia.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Olivia? I thought she was marrying Connor! (pause) Oh right, real life more important.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: So do you think that my dream means anything?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I don't know. I mean, you saw him do a love scene, so maybe you don't have a thing for Joey, maybe you have a thing for Drake.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Ah! Well it was Joey reading Drake's lines in the dream...

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Of course it was! Trust me, when it comes to psychology I know what I'm talking about. I took two psych classes in college.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: You took the same class twice.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: It was hard!
(Phoebe comes in)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Rachel and Monica
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Here, Monica, look what I got to wear when I play at the restaurant (she dons a top hat) uh, huh wait! (she raises a pair of spectacles to her eyes) Right? I mean, this might even class up the ballad of the uncircumcised man.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh...Phoebe? Maybe I wasn't clear before. I really love listening to your music here, but my restaurant is sort of an upscale place.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Right, yeah, ok, I'll ask the butler to fetch my diamonds out of the vault.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Phoebe, it's not what you wear. It's sort of your songs... I just don't think you should play at the restaurant anymore.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh, ok. Fine, I'll just, I'll take the hat back (she puts the hat in a bag and she crushes it angrily on the floor with her foot).
(silence)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Hey, so you guys, the funniest thing happened, at work...

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: My songs aren't good enough for your restaurant?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Ok, we're still on that.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I didn't say your songs were not good enough.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Then what's wrong with them? Would they not go with your tiny portions of pretentious food?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Tiny portions?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Yeah well, "excuse me, I ordered the smoked salmon appetizer, but (peering through her spectacles) I can't see it, I can't see it"!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Phoebe, it's not about quantity.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Well...it's not about quality.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh really, you want to talk about quality? Have you heard of a key? It's what some people sing in.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Well at least all my songs don't taste like garlic. Yeah, there are other ingredients Monica.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Ok, so that's what we're doing. You know, when I'm in the coffee house bopping along to one of your songs, I'm wearing ear plugs.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Ear plugs, or cloves of garlic?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: You know what? I take back what I said before. You keep playing at the restaurant, because with your music driving people inside, my bar sales are going up like crazy.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: What are people having, the garlic Martini?
[Scene: Hotel's reception]

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.text: Here's your copy of the bill, we hope you enjoyed your stay.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Oh we did, and you still have all your lamps.
(the receptions is puzzled. She goes in the back.)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Oh, I didn't factor in the room tax.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh dude, don't worry about it, I found an unattended maid's car. We're way ahead of the game.
(they make as if to go, but Ross notices something)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: There's something new in the bowl.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Look, we have enough, just walk away.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: No, but I want...I want the pinecones!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: There's a forest right outside.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: It's not the same.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Ok, go quick!
(Ross starts stuffing pinecones in the suitcase. As the receptionist walks in, Chandler makes a bird's verse and Ross stops)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (to the receptionist) Thank you for a delightful stay.
(he picks up the suitcase, which falls open, revealing all the stuff they have taken from the hotel. The receptionist just looks at them.)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, my maple candy!
[Scene: In front of Monica's restaurant. Phoebe is playing]

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (singing) Food here at 'Javu'..will kill you..the food here at 'Javu' ...will kill you..
(Monica comes out)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Thank god, it's just you! I thought someone was swinging a bag of cats against the wall.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: You'd better get back in that kitchen Monica, the garlic is not gonna overuse itself.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Ok, you have to stop playing now.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Why? The only person my playing is bothering is you!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh yeah? Ok, let's settle this, come on!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (while Monica drags her in the restaurant) Get your garlic-peelers off me!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: (to the restuarant customers) Excuse me, excuse me, hi, I'm Monica Geller..I'm the head chef here.. (pauses as if waiting for something).. Ok, I was actually expecting a little applause there, but whatever! Ok, quick question: by a show of hands, how many of you were bothered by this woman's singing outside? (a few people raise their hands)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Ok, ok, how many of you enjoyed the music outside? (a few people raise their hands) Ha!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Alright, let me ask you this question: How many of you thought the music was fine, but not in keeping with the tone of the restaurant? (a few raise their hands again).

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Ok, well, who identified the tone of this restaurant as pretentious comma garlicky?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Ok who thinks the food is delicious and a little pretention never hurt anyone? (a few raise their hands)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Ok, well, alright, who thinks the food is fine, the music was fine, but your evening was ruined by this incessant poll taking? (all raise their hands).

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Excuse us! (then to Phoebe) Alright here's a question: Who was so worried about her restaurant being fancy that she made a big deal about her friend playing her music and feels really bad about it now? (raises her hand)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh...Who was so stupid and stubborn that she lashed out against her friend's cooking which she actually thinks is pretty great! (raises her hand)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I'm sorry...

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: I'm sorry too... (they hug)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: ooohh... hey! Wanna stick around and I'll whip you up some dinner?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Yeah! As long as it's free! Food here is ridiculously over-p...
(Monica seems to take it amiss)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (smiling, raising her hand) Who's hoping the hand raising thing is still cute enough that you won't hate me?

scene_description: Rachel walks in
raw_text:
[Scene: Joey and Rachel's apartment, Rachel walks in]
Rachel: Hey!
Joey: Hey!
Rachel: Joey, do you have peanut butter on the back of your head?
Joey: (Touches the back of his head and licks his fingers) Oh man! I thought I got it all!
Rachel: (looks puzzled) How...how...?
Joey: I was making a peanut butter smoothy, right? 
Rachel: uh-huh
Joey: And I couldn't find this little plastic thing (holds up plastic thing) that goes on top of the blender...and I thought...well... how important can that be, right...? Turns out very! 
Rachel: (to herself) Wow...definitely just Drake...
Joey: What?
Rachel: What...how is it going with Drake?
Joey: Oh...I don't think it's going very well...
Rachel: What...that scene I saw was so good!
Joey: Well, I'm feeling really insecure about the one we are shooting tomorrow...
Rachel: Joey, is this that thing that you do when you say you're bad so I'll give you a compliment?
Joey: A little. Yeah no, I really am worried, you know, I mean I have to make it convincing that I'm in love with Olivia.
Rachel: So?
Joey: So...I've never played that!
Rachel: Ooh! Honey, it can't be that hard, I mean, you've been in love before?
Joey: Uh...well...just once...with you...
Rachel: Ok...this could be a little awkward...I'm just going to blow past it... well can't you just use that method actor thing where you use your real life memories to help you in your performance?
Joey: (looks at her for a moment) What the hell are you talking about??
Rachel: (shakes her head) Alright, alright look, just uh... just try to remember how  you felt when you were in love, and think about that when you're playing the scene.
Joey: (approvingly) Oh! ok, yeah, I think I can do that. Yeah ok, there's this party scene coming up.. and Olivia and her husband are there and all Drake wants to do is grab her and kiss her, but he can't... And that makes me think about all those times when I wanted to grab you and kiss you, but you didn't know so I would just pretend everything was cool, but really, it was killing me.
Rachel: (looks touched) Joey, you never..you never talked about that before...
Joey: Well.. hey, you know what else I could use? There's a scene where Drake sneaks into Olivia's bedroom, and she doesn't know he's there - which never happened with us! And he knows he shouldn't be there, but he just wants to look at her... you know? (In a romantic voice) And I remember all those mornings before you even put on your make-up, when I would think to myself, my God, she...is... beautiful... (Rachel looks very moved) and it hurts so much, cuz I knew I could never tell you (pauses, while looking at her with sentiment) but it was worth it just to be there looking at you.
(Joey and Rachel continue to look at each other in silence for a while)
Joey: (excited) Thanks dude!!!This is GREAT!! (leaves Rachel very touched on the couch and goes into his room)
Closing credits
